p: In western countries, over the last 2–3 decades, there has also been a progressive shift from esophageal to prosthetic voice rehabilitation [5]. An intrinsic characteristic of modern voice prostheses is the need for office-based replacement within a median time of 70 days (95% CI 67–73) [5]. For the aforementioned characteristics, management of laryngectomized patients poses a challenge for the otolaryngologist during the current COVID-19 pandemic.
